alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley; Harvey; Marion; McPherson; Sedgwick; Sumner (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 1:54PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Locally strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McPherson, western Cowley, Sedgwick, Harvey, southwestern Butler, western Marion and eastern Sumner Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 152 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking locally strong thunderstorms with heavy rainfall along a line extending from Lindsborg to near Eisenhower National Airport to 7 miles southeast of Wellington. Movement was east-northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, Newton, Mcpherson, Arkansas City, Winfield, Andover, Haysville, Wellington, Park City, Valley Center, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Rose Hill, Hesston, Lindsborg, Maize, Clearwater, Halstead and North Newton. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 between Mile Markers 0 and 76. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 6 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Butler; Cowley; Harvey; Marion; McPherson; Sedgwick; Sumner
